title: How to Make Mini Eggnog Cheesecakes

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Crush up graham cracker crumbs.
steps.description: You'll need them for your crust.

steps.headline: Combine graham cracker crumbs, melted butter and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg.
Put the crust into each of the liners.
steps.description: Press down gently to set into place.

steps.headline: Blend the cream cheese and sugar together.
Add your egg, eggnog, flour, 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg and vanilla.
Scoop out your batter into the liners.
Bake.
steps.description: Wait 20 minutes or until the center is set.

steps.headline: Allow them to cool.
steps.description: Let them cool for at least 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the cheesecakes from the pan.
Refrigerate for 4-5 hours or longer.
steps.description: This will allow them to set fully.

steps.headline: Add a final extra touch!
steps.description: Top your cheesecakes with whipped cream and sprinkle on some nutmeg.

text: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.  Prepare your muffin pan. Put 9 liners in your pan. Crush up graham cracker crumbs. You'll need them for your crust. Combine graham cracker crumbs, melted butter and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg. Incorporate well. Put the crust into each of the liners. Press down gently to set into place. Blend the cream cheese and sugar together. Blend until they are creamy. Add your egg, eggnog, flour, 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg and vanilla. Mix until blended. Scoop out your batter into the liners. Fill them about 3/4 full. Bake. Wait 20 minutes or until the center is set. Allow them to cool. Let them cool for at least 30 minutes. Remove the cheesecakes from the pan.  Refrigerate for 4-5 hours or longer. This will allow them to set fully. Add a final extra touch! Top your cheesecakes with whipped cream and sprinkle on some nutmeg.
